title: Three injured by shotgun blast in Joliet
content:
JOLIET - Two men and a boy were injured during a shooting Monday.
Deputy Chief Ed Gregory said the incident occurred at 2:55 p.m. in the 200 block of North Hickory Street.
"An officer was in the area and heard the shooting. Witnesses said the victims had been in front of the residence with several people and some people ran inside afterward," Gregory said.
The three people who were injured fled the scene in a silver Chevrolet Monte Carlo that officers stopped a few minutes later at Jefferson and Nicholson streets, Gregory said.
A 26-year-old man suffered an injury from a shotgun blast to his eye while a 21-year-old man and a 15-year-old boy sustained minor injuries. All three victims live in Crest Hill.
Gregory said none of the injuries were life-threatening and "two of the three victims refused to give statements" to police.
One shotgun shell was found on the front porch of the residence, and police were obtaining a warrant to search inside as of 6 p.m. Monday, Gregory said.
